net.sourceforge.nite.gui.util
Class OntologyPopupMenu

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPopupMenu
                  net.sourceforge.nite.gui.util.OntologyPopupMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.MenuElement
public class OntologyPopupMenu
extends javax.swing.JPopupMenu

A popupmenu with contents filled from an ontology in a NXT corpus.

main features:

  • Popupmenu hierarchy reflects ontology tree.
  • User can set node which serves as root -- all descendants below that node are included in the popup menu.
  • User can select whether to display or hide the 'root node' in the popup menu. If hide, menu starts with first-level-children
  • User can choose what action will be fired when a menu item is selected
  • User can choose whether intermediate nodes (non-leafs) will also fire the action.
  • PopupMenuItems conform to a NOMElementContainer interface, which means that the corresponding NOMElement (a node in the ontology) can be found from the PopupMenuItem and therefore indirectly from the ActionEvent. Given the ActionEvent ae, you can find the NOMElement from the ontology which was selected in the menu by calling ((NOMElementContainer)ae.getSource()).getElement().

Author:
Dennis Reidsma, UTwente
See Also:

Constructor Detail

OntologyPopupMenu

public OntologyPopupMenu(NOMCorpus nom,
                         java.lang.String displayAttribute,
                         java.awt.event.ActionListener actionCallback,
                         java.lang.String rootID,
                         boolean addLeavesForNodes,
                         boolean includeRoot)
Parameters:
nom - the corpus in which the ontology resides
displayAttribute - the name of an attribute of the elements in the ontology which is used for the display text of corresponding elements in the popup menu
actionCallback - the ActionListener that is called when an item in the popupmenu is clicked.
rootID - the element ID of the top-node in the menu, of which all descendants should be added (it's a NOM ID, so it's prefixed with the colour, e.g. "daa#mrda_11a")
addLeavesForNodes - if true, the popup menu will contain leaf-elements for each non-leaf-node. This makes it possible to select intermediate nodes from the ontology hierarchy instead of only leaves.
includeRoot - if true, the popupmenu will have the rootElement as its first-level menu item
